summary: This document is a compilation of daily lieutenant's logs from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York for July 10, 2019. It details routine operations, inmate counts, and specific entries regarding inmate Jeffrey Epstein, who was on psychological observation. The logs also record other inmate movements, releases, and incidents.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Listed as inmate #76318-054, initially on psychological observation with an inmate companion during the morning watch, and was removed from psychological observation at 12:15 PM during the day watch.

persons.name: Gebremariam
persons.context: Listed as inmate #79792-007, noted as being on psychological observation with an inmate companion throughout all three recorded shifts on July 10, 2019.

connections.description: Both inmates were on psychological observation with inmate companions during the same shift, as noted in the log's sensitive information section.

events.title: Epstein on Psychological Observation
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein (#76318-054) is listed as being on psychological observation with an inmate companion during the morning watch. He was removed from psychological observation at 12:15 PM.

events.title: Inmate Fight and Administrative Detention
events.description: Inmates Figueroa and Maquilon were escorted from their unit to ZA for fighting at 6:23 PM. Both were subsequently placed in Administrative Detention.

events.title: Routine Inmate Movements and Releases
events.description: The log details multiple routine events including inmate releases (Guzman, Martinez, Siders), new commitments (Carabus, Chan, Reyes, Williams), and a hospital transport (Maksimovic).

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was on psychological observation with an inmate companion at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on July 10, 2019.
Epstein was removed from psychological observation at 12:15 PM on that date.
The facility's fire alarm and sprinkler system were non-operational during the morning watch but operational later.
The PREA (Prison Rape Elimination Act) announcement could not be conducted during the day and evening watches due to a public address system malfunction.
The log records routine inmate counts, equipment checks, and several specific inmate incidents including a fight and administrative detentions.
